title: Tadworth Walks

images.title: Hywel Williams, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Tadworth Station. There are two national rail stations, Tadworth close to the centre of the village and for some residents Tattenham Corner railway station is nearer, adjoining Epsom Downs. Both are in Oyster card Zone 6 and are run by the Southern Railway.

images.title: Tadworth Court, Tadworth by Stephen Richards, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Tadworth Court is a grand Grade I listed building and was built at the height of Queen Anne style architecture in the very early 18th century – namely here in 1700 for Leonard Wessels, Lord of the Manor of Banstead. It is the home of the Children's Trust, a national charity providing special care for severely disabled children and rehabilitation to children with acquired brain injuries.

images.title: Tadworth Windmill by Ian Capper, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Tadworth Windmill

images.title: John Barrett / The Kingswood Arms
images.caption: The Kingswood Arms. The Kingswood Arms was built to replace the Station Hotel which was burned down in 1912. Modernised in 1968 it was for a while named the Pigeon Pair, recalling Kingswood's involvement in the early days of Reuters News Agency. Kingswood is located just east of Tadworth.

images.title: Banstead Heath by Ian Capper, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Banstead Heath

images.title: John Barrett / Banstead Heath
images.caption: Banstead Heath. View looking north from close to the Sportsman Pub

images.title: Epsom Downs: horses in training by Hugh Craddock, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Epsom Downs, horses in training

images.title: Bill Boaden / Epsom Downs
images.caption: Epsom Downs. This is a very pleasant place to walk, and the surrounding race course is not all intrusive or restrictive.

description: This Surrey based village is surrounded by some lovely North Down scenery. It sits right on the edge of Banstead Heath where there are miles of good walking and cycling trails to try. To the north is Epsom Downs where you can enjoy views of the famous Epsom Racecourse. This circular walk starts from the train station and visits these two local highlights using a series of good public footpaths. There's much to enjoy with peaceful woodland trails and moderate hill climbs providing excellent views over the surrounding countryside.
